channel.title: Wicked Cool Words - New Posts
channel.description: The latest word posts from Wicked Cool Words

item.title: Fulminate
item.description: Verb. To make a verbal attack.

item.title: Bifurcate
item.description: Verb. To divide or fork into two channels or branches.

item.title: Paraparetic
item.description: Noun. Exhibiting or relating to paraparesis (weakness of both legs, resulting from disease of the nervous system).

item.title: Habitus
item.description: Noun. Habitude; mode of life; bearing, general appearance.

item.title: Lagoon
item.description: Noun. A shallow body of water separated from deeper sea by a bar.

item.title: Abscond
item.description: Verb. To flee, often secretly; to steal away, particularly to avoid arrest or prosecution.

item.title: Acerbic
item.description: Adjective. Tasting sour or bitter.

item.title: Ambush
item.description: Noun. The act of concealing oneself and lying in wait to attack by surprise.

item.title: Hurkle Durkle
item.description:
Verb. To lie in bed for a long time, to lounge around

This word comes from the excellent HaggardHawks language and etymology blog. It cropped up in my twitter feed recently and I’ve set a personal goal to use it 10 times in regular conversation before the end of the year. Interestingly enough, it also lines up with another goal of mine: stop hurkle-durkling so much.

Word of the Day; HURKLE-DURKLE (v.) to lie in bed for a long time, to lounge around

— Haggard Hawks 📚🦅 (@HaggardHawks) March 28, 2015

item.title: Decimate
item.description:
Verb. To reduce to one-tenth: to destroy or remove nine-tenths of anything.

This post has some context in reality as many estimates show that Hurricane Irma decimated the island of Barbuda. Over 90% of the buildings in the sole Barbudan town of Codrington were reported destroyed, with some reports stating as high as 95%. Hurricane Jose is now bearing down on the island and it’s similarly-devastated neighbors.

Hurricane Irma is now heading towards Florida.

Latest computer runs showing essentially all of Florida in the path of #Irma. This is...no words. pic.twitter.com/02hhBVkIoh

— Bill McKibben (@billmckibben) September 7, 2017

item.title: Icosamate
item.description: Verb. To reduce to one-twentieth: to destroy or remove 95% of anything.

item.title: Pintle
item.description: Noun. A pin or bolt, usually vertical, which acts as a pivot for a hinge or a rudder.

item.title: Lope
item.description: Verb. To travel an easy pace with long strides.

item.title: Furtive
item.description: Adjective. Exhibiting guilty or evasive secrecy.

item.title: Discern
item.description: Verb. To perceive, recognize, or comprehend with the mind; to descry.

item.title: Shoal
item.description: Noun. A sandbank or sandbar creating a shallow.

item.title: Mammoth
item.description: Noun. (figuratively) Something very large of its kind.

item.title: Derringer
item.description: Noun. A type of very small, concealable pistol with one or two barrels, but without any loading system or magazine.

item.title: Kipuka
item.description: Noun. (geology) A zone of unharmed land completely surrounded by lava flows.

item.title: Andiron
item.description: Noun. A utensil for supporting wood when burning in a fireplace, one being placed on each side.

item.title: Immiscible
item.description: Adjective. (physics) (of two or more liquids) that are not mutually soluble; unmixable

item.title: Knelt
item.description: Verb. To stoop down and rest on the knee or knees

item.title: Salubrious
item.description: Adjective. Promoting health or well-being; wholesome, especially as related to air.

item.title: Cravat
item.description: Noun. A bandage resembling a cravat, particularly a triangular bandage folded into a strip.

item.title: Current
item.description: Noun. The part of a fluid that moves continuously in a certain direction.

item.title: Sarcasm
item.description: Noun. Use of acerbic language to mock or convey contempt, often using irony and (in speech) often marked by overemphasis and a sneering tone of voice.

item.title: Lithe
item.description: Adjective. Slim but not skinny.

item.title: Fizzle
item.description: Verb. To sputter or hiss.

item.title: Hemisphere
item.description: Noun. Half of the Earth, such as the Northern Hemisphere, Southern Hemisphere, Western Hemisphere or Eastern Hemisphere, Land Hemisphere, Water Hemisphere etc.

item.title: Emulsion
item.description: Noun. A stable suspension of small droplets of one liquid in another with which it is immiscible.

item.title: Pickwickian
item.description: Adjective. Arbitrary or meaningless.

item.title: Inshallah
item.description: God willing; Deo volente; expressing the speaker’s wish for a given future event to occur, especially in a Muslim country or Islamic context.

item.title: Coagulate
item.description: Verb. To become congealed; to convert from a liquid to a semisolid mass.

item.title: Squash
item.description: Noun. A plant and its fruit of any of a few species of the genus Cucurbita, or gourd kind.

item.title: Putz
item.description: Noun. (slang) Fool, idiot.

item.title: Emulsify
item.description: Verb. To make into an emulsion.

item.title: Lugubrious
item.description: Adjective. Gloomy, mournful or dismal, especially to an exaggerated degree.

item.title: Toches
item.description: Noun. From Yiddish תּחת (tokhes, “buttocks”), in turn from Hebrew תחת (tákhat, “buttocks”).

item.title: Proboscis
item.description: Noun. An elongated tube from the head or connected to the mouth, of an animal.

item.title: Contemporaneous
item.description: Adjective. Existing or created in the same period of time.

item.title: Jamoke
item.description: Noun. (slang) Stupid person, fool.

item.title: Stunod
item.description: Adjective. Stupid or crazy; out of touch with reality; disagreeable.

item.title: Fliquer
item.description: Verb. French. (informal) to police.

item.title: Pleonastic
item.description: Adjective. Using an excessive number of words; especially using different words having the same meaning.

item.title: Gusset
item.description: Noun. A small piece of cloth inserted in a garment, for the purpose of strengthening some part or giving it a tapering enlargement.

item.title: De Rigeur
item.description: Adjective. Necessary according to etiquette, protocol or fashion.

item.title: Calamitous
item.description: Adjective. Concerning or involving calamity, disastrous.

item.title: Abscond
item.description: Verb. To flee, often secretly; to steal away, particularly to avoid arrest or prosecution.

item.title: Perpetuity
item.description: Noun. The quality or state of being perpetual; endless duration; uninterrupted existence.

item.title: Covfefe
item.description: Literally nobody knows what this word means.

item.title: Rigmarole
item.description: Noun. Complex, obsolete procedures; excess steps or activity; needless motion.

item.title: Hovel
item.description: Noun. An open shed for sheltering cattle, or protecting produce, etc., from the weather.

item.title: Ooze
item.description:
Verb.

(intransitive) To be secreted or slowly leak.

(intransitive, figuratively) To give off a sense of (something).

item.title: Oubliette
item.description: Noun. A dungeon only accessible by a trapdoor at the top.

item.title: Tympanic
item.description: Adjective. Of, relating to, or resembling a drum.

item.title: Applique
item.description: Noun. a decorative design made by cutting pieces of material and applying them to the surface of another for decoration.

item.title: Dicker
item.description: Verb. To bargain, haggle or negotiate over a sale.

item.title: Mnemonic
item.description: Adjective. Of or relating to mnemonics: the study of techniques for remembering anything more easily.

item.title: Erudite
item.description: Adjective. Learned, scholarly, with emphasis on knowledge gained from books.

item.title: Prow
item.description: Noun. The fore part of a vessel; the bow; the stem; hence, the vessel itself.

item.title: Riparian
item.description: Adjective. Of or relating to the bank of a river or stream.

item.title: Penurious
item.description: Adjective. Miserly; excessively cheap.

item.title: Demonym
item.description: Noun. A name for an inhabitant or native of a specific place that is derived from the name of the place.

item.title: Deflect
item.description: Verb. To make (something) deviate from its original path.

item.title: Glabrous
item.description: Adjective. Smooth, hairless; bald.

item.title: Assignation
item.description: Noun. The act of assigning or allotting; apportionment.

item.title: Quirt
item.description: Noun. A rawhide whip plaited with two thongs of buffalo hide.

item.title: Tautological
item.description: Adjective. Using repetition or excessive wordiness; pleonastic or circumlocutionary.

item.title: Flense
item.description: Verb. To strip the blubber or skin from, as from a whale, seal, etc.

item.title: Rakehell
item.description: Noun. A lewd or wanton person; a debauchee; a rake.

item.title: Germane
item.description: Adjective. Related to the topic being discussed or considered.

item.title: Nictate
item.description: Verb. To wink or blink; (of certain animals) to close the nictating membrane.

item.title: Swell
item.description: Verb. To grow gradually in force or loudness.

item.title: Tympanic
item.description: Adjective. Of, relating to, or resembling a drum.

item.title: Perfidy
item.description: Noun. A state or act of violating faith or allegiance; violation of a promise or vow, or of trust reposed; faithlessness; treachery.

item.title: Bright
item.description: Adjective. Visually dazzling; luminous, lucent, clear, radiant; not dark.

item.title: Languorous
item.description: Adjective. Lacking energy, spirit, liveliness or vitality; languid, lackadaisical

item.title: Pouch
item.description: Noun. A small bag usually closed with a drawstring.

item.title: Haven
item.description: Noun. A harbour or anchorage protected from the sea.

item.title: Cottage
item.description: Noun. A seasonal home of any size or stature. A recreational home or a home in a remote location.

item.title: Jodhpurs
item.description: Noun. Flared riding trousers of heavy cloth, fitting tightly from knee to ankle.

item.title: Pod
item.description: Noun. (botany) A seed case for legumes (e.g. peas, beans, peppers).

item.title: Defenestrate
item.description: Verb. To eject or throw (someone or something) from a window.

item.title: Verisimilitude
item.description: Noun. The property of seeming true, of resembling reality; resemblance to reality, realism.

item.title: Azure
item.description: Noun. A blue colour on a coat of arms, represented in engraving by horizontal parallel lines.

item.title: Repiquer
item.description:
Verb. To pinch; to steal again.

This word was the highest scoring word played by the computer simulation of Scrabble run by James P. Curley in his analysis.

item.title: Enclave
item.description: Noun. A political, cultural or social entity or part thereof that is completely surrounded by another.

item.title: Cocoon
item.description: Noun. The silky protective case spun by the larvae of some insects and moths in which they metamorphose, the pupa.

item.title: Kith
item.description: Noun. (Northern England, Scotland, rural) An acquaintance or a friend.

item.title: Smock
item.description: Noun. A loose garment worn as protection by a painter, etc.

item.title: Batrachian
item.description: Adjective. Pertaining to a frog or toad.

item.title: Blanched
item.description: Adjective. Lacking complexion or color.

item.title: Constabulary
item.description: Noun. The police in a particular district or area.

item.title: Ramshackle
item.description: Adjective. In disrepair or disorder; poorly maintained; lacking upkeep, usually of buildings or vehicles.

item.title: Imbroglio
item.description: Noun. A complicated situation; an entanglement.

item.title: Concision
item.description: Noun. Conciseness, brevity or terseness.

item.title: Slake
item.description: Verb. To satisfy (thirst, or other desires); to quench; to extinguish.

item.title: Scotch
item.description: Noun. A surface cut or abrasion.

item.title: Hyaloid
item.description: Adjective. Transparent or glossy.

item.title: Acuminate
item.description: Adjective. Tapering to a point; pointed.

item.title: Peduncle
item.description:
Noun. The axis of an inflorescence; the stalk supporting an inflorescence.

The #BloomWatch marches on! 70% of Yoshino cherry trees at peduncle elongation, the fourth of six stages to peak bloom. #CherryBlossomDC pic.twitter.com/bnCSOYYFDo

— National Mall NPS (@NationalMallNPS) March 8, 2017

item.title: Ligulate
item.description: Adjective. Shaped like a strap or long tongue.

item.title: Dross
item.description: Noun. Waste or impure matter

item.title: Tombolo
item.description: Noun. A spit of sand linking an island to the mainland (or to another island), formed by longshore drift.

item.title: Ictus
item.description: Noun. The stress of voice laid upon an accented syllable of a word.

item.title: Excrescence
item.description: Noun. Something, usually abnormal, which grows out of something else.

item.title: Credo
item.description: Noun. A belief system.

item.title: Braggadocio
item.description:
Noun. 1. A braggart. 2. Empty boasting.

After Braggadocchio, boastful character in Edmund Spenser’s The Faerie Queene (1590), apparently a pseudo-Italian coinage.

item.title: Affittare
item.description: Verb. To rent out, to let, to hire out something.

item.title: Spancel
item.description: Noun. A rope or fetter used to hobble a horse or other animal.

item.title: Excrescence
item.description: Noun. Something, usually abnormal, which grows out of something else.

item.title: Electrophorus
item.description: Noun. Any early apparatus, consisting of a rubber disk and a metal plate, for generating static electricity.

item.title: Chatoyant
item.description:
Adjective. Having a certain optical reflectance effect, which can be likened to the sheen of a spool of silk.

Noun. A hard stone, such as the cat’s-eye, which presents on a polished surface, and in the interior, an undulating or wavy light.
